Australia: Western Australia became a penal colony.
Colombia:
Foundation of Manizales by Antioquian colonists
José Hilario López is President of the Republic of New Granada
Germany: German revolutions of 1848–49: The chamber of the Frankfurt Parliament, since reduced to a rump parliament and moved to Stuttgart, was occupied by the Württemberg army. A repression began which would force the liberal Forty-Eighters into exile.
Italy:
A Roman Republic is declared following an election.
Mazzini arrives in Rome and is appointed Chief Minister of the Roman Republic.
Malta: Malta was granted a Constitution providing for a Council of Government of eighteen members of whom eight were to be elected by the people.
Slovenia:
The Duchy of Carinthia is created as a separate crownland.
First locomotive arrives at Ljubljana railway station.
First train of the "Southern Railway" arrives in Ljubljana.
"Southern Railway" to Ljubljana is ceremonially opened.
